div.p: ANTONIO: We've been talking about lifestyle-related health problems.
ANTONIO: And the first one we're going to focus on is heart disease; something most people think could happen to them.
ANTONIO: Okay. Now, I know it might seem a little strange to talk about heart disease in a drug and alcohol program. But you'll see how it ties in shortly.

ANTONIO: So, there's a good chance you know someone living with heart disease, or someone who's died from a heart attack. A friend, a colleague, maybe even a family member. Heart disease is—unfortunately—very common.

ANTONIO: And that's why we're looking at heart disease first; most of us are familiar with it. We'll use heart disease to learn some important principles that we can then apply to all lifestyle-related health problems.
ANTONIO: And those principles can help us prevent future problems with drugs and alcohol.
